caption: Figure 1 A prototypical example of a structural equation model with a clear distinction between the measurement part and the structural part of the model. The structural part of the model (inside the dashed box) is an example of a multiple regression model. The measurement part relates the latent variables (Y , X1, X2 and X3) to their respective set of indicators. Independent error terms for endogenous variables and indicators have been omitted for visual simplicity.

Figure 2 A prototypical example of a structural equation model with a clear distinction between the measurement part and the structural part of the model. The structural part of the model (inside the dashed box) is an example of a path model. Independent error terms for endogenous variables and indicators have been omitted for visual simplicity.
Figure 3 An example of a model where there is no clear distinction between the measurement part and the structural part. Local SAM cannot be applied for this model.
